summary: The Fresh Start Act of 2025 amends the Brady Handgun Violence Prevention Act to establish grants for states to modernize criminal justice data infrastructure, facilitating automated record sealing and expungement. The bill defines "covered expungement laws" and mandates annual reporting to the Attorney General on the number of individuals eligible for and undergoing record expungement/sealing, disaggregated by demographic data, along with plans for data collection. The Attorney General will publish this data annually.
